intro: Pentacalia zakii, commonly known as the Zaki's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed and related species. The plant is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and fleshy, waxy leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Pentacalia zakii is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat, with features that help it conserve water and survive in harsh environments.
